transcripts.text: And just because I don't technically have Jewish family that are blood related to me, it doesn't mean I don't take this as seriously.  And it is very dangerous.

This week, Meghan McCain broke down and cried on The View.  Now, it wasn't even really clear what she was crying about.  It appeared to be her fear of Ilhan Omar and, I mean, rising anti-Semitism, but somehow she was putting that on Ilhan Omar.  Now, before I even get to that clip, I want to show you a clip that really is not being shared around too much, and that's the clip before Meghan McCain had her breakdown, and I think it's Part of the reason that Meghan McCain was triggered and began crying because Sonny Hostin completely eliminated any idea that Ilhan Omar is anti-Semitic.  So let me play this clip and then I think you'll have a better idea of what exactly the argument is and why Meghan McCain had nowhere else to go but use her tears.  Watch.

So the comment she said was, so for me, I want to talk about the political influence in this country that says it is OK for people to push for allegiance to a foreign country.  And I want to ask, why is it OK for me to talk about the influence of the NRA, of fossil fuel industries, or big pharma, and not talk about a powerful lobby that is influencing policy?  That's what she said.  And people say that that is anti-Semitic.  When we had Barry Weiss on as an expert in what is anti-Semitic and what isn't, I asked her, is it okay to talk about Israel's policies and not be called anti-Semitic?  And she said yes.  She said where it crosses the line is when you say that Israel does not have the right to exist.  that that is when it crosses the line.  Now, Omar has never suggested that Israel does not have the right to exist.  So, to me, it seems to me that Republicans are trying to use this as a wedge issue.  And I think that, you know, this selective outrage is kind of Crazy, because I don't think that the Republicans have moral high ground here.  It seems like Democrats are upset too, though.  I think that Kevin McCarthy has used these anti-Semitic tropes.  I think that Jim Jordan just recently tweeted this.  Against Tom Steyer.  And remember that Ilhan Omar in the West Virginia Republican Party just had this huge poster superimposed with her face with 9-11 terrorists.  And I haven't heard any outrage about that coming from the Republican Party.  So, and all that to say is that this selective outrage, and I will tell you, I take this very personally as a woman of color who has, you know, been the subject of so much bigotry.  And what a lot of people don't know is that my grandfather is Jewish.  He is a Sephardic Jew.  And so I have... You know, my family members have received a lot of bigotry.  So, you know, I've experienced firsthand in my family anti-Semitism and bigotry for being black.  And so I just, this whole, you know, thing, I think it's just a distraction.

All right.  I think Sonny Hostin here did a fantastic job of breaking down this whole situation.  Now, just a few comments here before I show Megan crying and show some reaction to Megan crying.  So while Sonny Hostin is talking, Joy Behar essentially has to like... baby Meghan McCain along.  so Sonny Hostin makes some comments that I think that Meghan McCain reacts to as if you know she's being offended and Joy Behar has to go.  don't worry she's not talking about you.
Republicans are trying to use this as a wedge issue.
And I think that... Not you.

Stop talking about you.  It's just funny to me because all the other co-hosts, even the other conservative ones, they all have to sort of babysit Meghan McCain on the panel.  I mean, she is such a child.  It's embarrassing.  The fact that she's still on this panel.  I mean, on this show.  Look... You will notice, if you watch the show, if you watch these clips, it's very rare for the audience to applause Meghan McCabe.  Everybody watching knows she is a trust fund baby.  They all know she's crazy.  They all know that she doesn't really understand anything.  They all know that she is only on this show.  She is only a host on The View because her father was a senator and her mother is a multimillionaire.  Meghan McCain has been handed everything.  She has no talent, no skill, no knowledge.  There is no reason why she should be on this show except for the fact that she is privileged and was born into wealth and her father was a senator.  That is the only reason at all.  for her for anybody to know who she is.  but one more comment before i go to megan mccain crying.  um i want to uh.  so sonny hostin here talks about how uh.  barry weiss who was on the show uh earlier on in the week said how.  uh yes you can be critical of israel but uh as soon as you are you know anti-zionist as soon as you believe that no israel doesn't have a right to exist then you are anti-semitic.  That's not true.  That's just, that's complete crap.  Anti-Zionism is not anti-Semitism.  It's simply, so... The more that this whole situation is unfolding between Israel and Palestine, the more and more people are recognizing that a one-state solution with human rights is the only answer here.  That Palestinians and the Jewish people have to be able to live in peace together in a one state.  I mean, when you have the Israeli government continuing with their settlements, encroaching on Palestinian land over and over and over, I mean, at this point, they have taken over essentially almost all of the Palestinian land.  So you have to get to a point now where you understand, look, this doesn't make any sense.  We have to be able to live together, live humanely in a one state.  It can happen.  Clearly, it's going to take a lot of time to be able to get people to soften up or something like that in the region.  But that is ultimately what needs to happen.  That's how you have peace in Palestine.  in Israel and with the Palestinian people, because there is no two-state solution here anymore, not with the way the right-wing Israeli government has been acting.  Now, let me go to Meghan McCain crying.  So you may have already seen this clip.  I'm going to play it again. So feel free to fast forward if you can't take it.  But here it is.

I have to admit, Megan, that it is disingenuous of the Republican Party to go after her at her point when they are backing a president who is in bed with dictators committing human rights violations all over the world.
And who traffics in bigotry.  Who traffics in bigotry.  Let's go there.

So just really quickly, since we're talking about... I take this very personally.  I would go so far as to say I probably verge on being a Zionist as well.  But I will say that I don't have... family that is Jewish, but Joe Lieberman and Hadassah Lieberman are my family.  Yeah.  And I take the hate crimes rising in this country incredibly seriously, and I think what's happening in Europe is really scary.  And I'm sorry if I'm getting emotional, but...

The idea that this is politicized, I'm really not, I was very nervous to talk about this on the show because I thought it would become politicized and it really shouldn't be.  On both sides, it should be called out.

And just because I don't technically have Jewish family that are blood related to me, it doesn't mean I don't take this as seriously and it is very dangerous.  Very dangerous.  And I think we all collectively as Americans on both sides and what Ilhan Omar is saying is very scary to me and it's very scary to a lot of people and I don't think you have to be Jewish to recognize that.

You don't.  And I just hope instead of a resolution just from the Democrats, I'm tired of the selective outrage.  And I hope that we have a joint resolution, perhaps, from Republicans and from the Democrats.  I would be in favor of a joint resolution.

She is politicizing it by not recognizing that the hate crimes that she is so scared of have risen not because of Ilhan Omar, but because of the fucking president and his dog whistling to white nationalism, to neo-Nazis. And I think he also makes some fantastic points here.

Let's look at big picture.  This resolution they're putting forward now on Thursday says really important things about the rise in the number of anti-Semitic attacks, the outrageous statements about Jews, discrimination, hate.  Ilhan Omar has nothing to do with any of that.  She's not expressed any hate, animus or discrimination.  And, you know, she's been on the receiving end of the hate.  She is a Republican.  party in West Virginia saying she's a terrorist.  You have an advisor to the president going on Fox and calling her filth.  So the idea that she should be targeted by a resolution is absurd.  And I would say one thing here, everything she said about Israel, she's pretty much said about Saudi Arabia.  So if she's an anti-Semite, she must be an Islamophobe as well.

She has been hard at Saudi Arabia from the beginning, which is worth noting.  And that poster there was in the West Virginia Capitol the other day, put up by the Republican Party.  So Mehdi Hassan here makes some great points.  And one of the points is a point I made earlier in the week on another video about Ilhan Omar.  And that's the idea that Ilhan Omar has been very critical of Saudi Arabia.  So does that make her Islamophobic, even though she's Muslim?  Of course not.  That would be ridiculous.  So why would be... critiquing or criticizing the Israeli government and what they're doing, why would that be anti-Semitic?  It wouldn't be.  And it also completely refutes this idea from Meghan McCain and Barry Weiss and others that claim Ilhan Omar is only focusing on Israel and nobody else.  No, if you actually look at what Ilhan Omar talks about, she's very engaged in human rights around the world.  She is clear about that.  Just because you don't have the ability to do your own research and figure that out doesn't make her anti-Semitic for focusing or for discussing Israel when she has a focus that is worldwide.  So again, I hope we can put this stupid debate to rest this week.  I've done multiple videos on this.  It is clear that Ilhan Omar has not been anti-Semitic.  She is simply pointing out an issue that very few politicians in Washington are willing to speak up on.
